title: Fortnite Chapter 7 Map For Season 1: All Map Changes
description: By     Phil Owen   on November 29, 2025 at 1:52PM PST                                GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases...
body:
By 
    Phil Owen
   on November 29, 2025 at 1:52PM PST    
          
                  GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                The last couple Fortnite Battle Royale islands have been based on real-life geography and ecosystems--Chapter 5 was Mediterranean Europe, and Chapter 6 was Japan. In Chapter 7, we've moved on to North America, and specifically the southwestern USA. The Chapter 7 map includes major locations based on Los Angeles, Las Vegas, San Francisco, and Area 51--in other words, it's Fortnite's San Andreas map.It all starts in Battlewood in the southwest portion of the new island, which has its own version of the iconic Hollywood sign and streets lined with palm trees. Nearby, you'll find the sound stages of Sus Studios, and you can take a ride up the freeway--yes, this map has Fortnite's first four-lane highway--to visit the casinos of the Sandy Strip. And smack in the middle of the map you won't find Tilted Towers or any other city. Instead, the heart of the island holds Innoloop Labs, an Area 51-esque spot where somebody is doing experiments on the Zero Point.But the highlight of the map is in the northeast, where you'll find a theme park called Wonkeeland, where you can ride a roller coaster--the first time Fortnite has had one of those since Chapter 3.There's no train on the Chapter 7 island, unfortunately, but there's something that might actually be better: hot air balloons. You can find several of these balloons floating around the island, and you can ride them to new places or use them as a sniper's nest.Fortnite's Chapter 7 map sure looks like a wild one. Scroll on for a better look at some of the key spots around the island.

title: Fortnite Festival Music Pass Featuring Lisa: All Skins, Emotes, Jam Tracks, And Instruments
description: By     Phil Owen   on November 29, 2025 at 6:39PM PST                                GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases...
body:
By 
    Phil Owen
   on November 29, 2025 at 6:39PM PST    
          
                  GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                After Fortnite Festival's most recent season didn't have a headliner, things are back to normal in Season 11 with the Starlux music pass featuring Lisa from Blackpink.This pass is pretty loaded, with eight jam tracks, two skins, two Kpop emotes, two guitars, a bass, a drum kit, a mic, three auras, and one weapon wrap. The Fortnite-original Melodie Mars skin is unlocked instantly when you purchase the pass, and the Rockstar Lisa skin is the final reward in the pass, she's got a reactive back bling on the pass as well.Those Icon emotes--which feature music from Can't Get Enough by Krystal Youngs and NiihWA, and Latata by I-dle--are a pretty surprising inclusion, as there have only been three total Icon emotes included in the previous 11`music passes. To have two of them on one music pass is very unusual.Of the eight jam tracks included in the Starlux pass, four are licensed and four are Epic-produced tracks. These are the licensed tracks.Get Jiggy by B Jack$, Zeddy WillDashstar* VIP by Knock2Sorry by Justin BieberF*** Up the World (Vixi Solo Version) by LisaIn all, the Starlux music pass includes 30 items, with one reward unlocking each two account levels you earn in any Fortnite experience. The pass costs 1,400 V-Bucks, and is included with a Fortnite Crew subscription. Scroll on to see everything you can collect from this one.

title: ROG Xbox Ally Handheld Is $100 Off For The Next Few Hours
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
    
              
          
                                                                                                                                                               The Asus ROG Xbox Ally is on sale for the first time since its October 16 launch. Best Buy has dropped the price of handheld gaming PC to $500 (was $600) as part of its Black Friday 9-Hour Flash Sale. Amazon is matching the $100 discount, so you can secure this deal at either retailer. You will need to be fast, though: This Black Friday deal ends tonight, November 29, at 10 PM PT (1 AM ET on November 30). Once Best Buy's deal ends, Amazon is very likely to increase the price back to $600.                                 Asus ROG Xbox Ally Gaming Handheld                                                                $500 (was $600) | Ends Nov. 29 at 10 PM PT                                                                                                                                                                                    The ROG Xbox Ally is a Windows gaming handheld with a custom console-like user interface. Check out the Xbox Ally's specs and features below. If you want to read more about the Xbox Ally and the higher-powered Xbox Ally X, check out our buying guide and our review of the Ally X.Specs:Processor: AMD Ryzen Z2 ARAM: 16GB LPDDR5X-6400Storage: 512GB M.2 2280 SSDDisplay:7" FHD IPS (Gorilla Glass Victus)120Hz refresh rateAMD FreeSync PremiumController Design:Contoured gripsHall Effect triggersShoulder bumpersABXY bumpers2 remappable back buttonsAnalog sticks with light rings6-Axis motion controlsHD haptics5 menu/settings buttonsPorts:2x USB 3.2 Type-C3.5mm audiomicroSD: UHS-II reader (only UHS-II)Network: Wi-Fi 6E / Bluetooth 5.4Battery: 80WhWeight: 670gDimensions: 290.8 x 121.5 x 50.7mm                                                                                                                                                                                                     Lexar Play Pro 1TB MicroSD Express For Switch 2 Gets Black Friday Discount                         DualSense Limited Edition PS5 Controllers On Sale For Black Friday                         Check Out Over 200 Nintendo Switch Game Deals For Black Friday                                   + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5)                 Eight Nintendo Switch Exclusives Are 50% Off In Walmart's Black Friday Sale                         The First PS5 Pro Deal In Six Months Is Up For Grabs For A Limited Time                         Ghost Of Yotei PS5 Slim Bundles And Collector's Edition Get Huge Discounts                         Save Big On 8BitDo's Stellar Ultimate 2 Controllers In Amazon's Black Friday Sale                         Evercade Retro Handhelds & Cartridges Get Rare Price Cuts In Amazon's Black Friday Sale
